commits.message: build: add pglite dependency and configure vite
commits.description: Adds the `@electric-sql/pglite` dependency and its data bundle. Updates Vite configuration to correctly handle WASM and data assets and excludes PGlite from optimization to prevent build issues.

commits.message: feat: implement core pglite client and types
commits.description: Introduces `src/db/postgres/types.ts` for defining interfaces related to PGlite query results, fields, table schemas, and errors. Creates `src/db/postgres/client.ts` which provides a singleton PGlite client instance and functions for initialization, query execution, readiness checks, and database resets.

commits.message: feat: add pglite database helper functions
commits.description: Adds `src/db/postgres/helpers.ts` containing utility functions for PGlite interactions. Includes `formatQueryResult` for consistent data representation, `parseError` for structured error handling, and functions to retrieve database metadata like `getTableList`, `getTableSchema`, and `getTableRowCount`.

Introduces `src/hooks/usePostgres.ts`, a custom React hook. This hook encapsulates the logic for initializing PGlite, managing its loading and ready states, and handling errors. It provides a convenient `executeQuery` method for React components to interact with the PGlite database.

commits.message: feat: integrate pglite into main app ui
commits.description: Updates `src/App.tsx` to utilize the new `usePostgres` hook. Displays the PGlite initialization status (loading, ready, error) to the user. Adds a basic user interface with a textarea for SQL input and a button to execute queries, presenting the results in a formatted block. Adjusts the page layout and title for the new functionality.
